alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 20 at 10:41PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM HST TUESDAY FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 145 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1034 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over portions of Puna and Kau Districts. Heaviest rain was falling in a band from near Pahoa to the Kawa Flats. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hawaiian Paradise Park, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Wood Valley, Pahala, Volcano, Punaluu Beach, Glenwood, Kawa Flats, Mountain View, Naalehu, Hawaiian Acres, Orchidland Estates, Keaau, Pahoa, Hawaiian Ocean View, Fern Forest, Eden Roc, Fern Acres and Waiohinu. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 145 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
